If seasoning has no flavour, it has no value. When a thing loses its essential quality and fails to perform its essential duty, it is good for nothing but to be thrown away.

    2. Purifying Agent: Salt is used for purification. The same way salt has healing power, Christians should counteract moral decay (2 Kings 20:21).  The purifying property of salt was referred to in its symbolic use by Elisha in his miracle of the healing the waters of Jericho. The symbolism of salt, therefore, in the words of our Lord Jesus, is clearly that the influence of a true Christian upon the world is healing, purifying influence, always tending to the preservation of that which is good from the adverse elements of putrefaction and decay.

    3. Preservative Agent: Salt gives food an improved length of life. The preservative qualities of salt make it, when so used, a fitting symbol of an enduring compact. Salt is the earliest of all preservatives. The Greeks used to say that salt could put "a new soul into dead things." Without salt some things will decay and go bad. Salt preserves food from decay. As the salt of the earth, we are called to preserve the faith which we have received and to pass it on intact to others. Our generation is being challenged in a special way to keep safe the deposit of faith (2 Thessalonians 2:15, 1 Timothy 6:20, 2 Timothy 1:14). We must act as a preservative against corruption and worldliness. We must be the conscience of the fellow believers, community and nation. We must not be contaminated in the circle we move. We must fearlessly speak the truth against all evils and support all good causes.

    4. Salt makes it easier for all good things to grow. A Christian should carry with him the quality of heaven manifesting the characteristics of salt.  Ultimately, those who know Jesus and acknowledge Him as Lord and Saviour will have eternal life. Salt is useless as long as it remains in the container. The salt must come in close contact with the food. As salt, Christians should come close to the people who are perishing and dying in sin to bring healing to them through the message of Jesus Christ. Being salt emphasises the need for Christians to be pure in heart and agents that purifys the stained, troubled hearts.

    5. Agent of Reconciliation: Salt reconciles ingredients of soup together: Salt brings together ingredients of soup and make it delicious. Christians are expected to influence the world by being agents of reconciliation. `Since Christians in this world are the ambassadors of Christs this means that the world is in rebellion against God. This world is an "imperial province" as far as God is concerned. He has sent His ambassadors into the world to declare peace, not war. "Be ye reconciled to God!" We represent Jesus Christ (John 20:21; 2 Corinthians 4:5). What a great privilege it is to be heaven\'s ambassadors to the rebellious sinners of this world! As agents of reconciliation, we must do our best to reconcile mankind to God.

    Sharing Time: If we are not truly and sincerely righteous, how can we exert upon others the cleansing, healing influence?

Facilitator's Closing Remarks

As Christ's disciples, we are to be the salt of the earth. Our life must influence the community we are and reflect the glory of God through contact with those who are perishing. We must act as life-preserving agents by proclaiming the Gospel of Christ. Christians who lose their saltiness become bitter and hardened and are of little use anymore, except to be trampled under-foot. Christians, like salt, need to live as pure a life as possible so that they can maximise their ability to flavour or bless the earth through good works and make impact in their generations. Our task is to be the salt of the earth preserving, reconciling, adding taste, giving meaning where there is no meaning, and giving hope where there is no hope. It is about the quality of life.

Activity Period

  1. Let a class member explain what salt does. Let individual class members reflect on what influence they make on their neighbour(s) or in their community.

title: the light for the society
message:
SEPTEMBER WEEK 3

THE LIGHT FOR THE SOCIETY

HYMN: BH 454 Light of the World, We Hail Thee

SCRIPTURE: Matthew 5: 14-16

Objectives :

By the end of the lesson, disciples should be able to:

  1. Understand the meaning and symbols of light.
  2. Influence the community of faith and the society at large.

ICE BREAKING PERIOD: Question and Answer

Why is it difficult for some Christian politicians to stand for truth when taking vital decisions to bring relief to citizens, especially the poor?

Facilitator's Opening Remarks

What does light do to darkness? Light dispels darkness because it is implacably opposed to it. The light that people see in Christians is the good works we do. The good works are the ones done in obedience to the living God. They include our character, conduct, actions, and our spoken testimony. Being light in the world is the only hope for the world. Our light shines when we live right to influence the community or society we live.

EDUCATION/INTERACTION PERIOD

  1. Light: An Allegory

    Light is a very common metaphor in the Bible. Light is often used to contrast knowledge and ignorance. Here, it stands for the world\'s opportunity to perceive the truth about Jesus. The world is "in the dark" about God, but Christians "turn on the lights." Light allows people to see. Christians lead the world to understand how much God loves them and what Jesus has done to restore relationship and reconcile with Him. Being the light of the world, we actually carry out the same purpose that Jesus had in coming to earth. The Gospel of John says that when Jesus was born, "the true light that gives light to every man was coming into the world" (John 1:9). Also He said, "I am the Light of the world. Whoever follows me will never walk in darkness, but will have the light of life" (John 8:12). Likewise, disciples should be like a light or lamp, which, if it is going to fulfil its function, must be on a lampstand and not hid under a bushel. The disciples were to be like a city set on a hill, and to let their light shine. The result would be that they would not attract men to themselves but would glorify the Father in heaven.

    Sharing Time: If you have walked in the dark before, then you would know the significance of light. How and what would the world look like without light?

  2. Characteristics of Light

    1. Light drives away the darkness: The first thing God did when He created the universe was to turn on the light! "Then God said, "Let there be light"; and there was light. And God saw that the light was good; and God separated the light from the darkness" (Genesis 1: 3-4, NRSV). Light dispels any forms of darkness: physical, spiritual and moral. The Light of salvation and life is for believers. Those responding to the light are ushered into the sphere of life in which darkness is dispelled. Salvation brings light to those in darkness.

    2. Light triumphs over darkness. There may be vast stretches of darkness, but the light cannot be extinguished. When light is introduced, darkness flees. Darkness and light cannot inhabit the same position. There are times when barriers are employed to prevent light from dispelling darkness, but once it does, the darkness is gone.

    3. Light divulges true colours: Light reveals true colour wherever it finds darkness or difficult to see. Our true colours (our behaviour, attitudes, and morals) are revealed in the light of God\'s Word. We are the channel by which the light is revealed. Every born-again believer has a light that must shine.

    4. Light directs your path: Light can show you the clear and "narrow way."  Light makes things grow.  Without light in the world humans would be as Jesus said, "blind leaders of the blind.  And if the blind leads the blind, both shall fall into the ditch" (Matthew 15:14). 

    5. Light makes things grow: Green plants make carbohydrates from carbon dioxide and water in the presence of chlorophyll, using energy captured from sunlight, and then they release excess oxygen as a byproduct that we breathe in as humans. This is called photosynthesis, and that\'s how things grow. We grow closer to God and grow (mature) in our faith with the light of God\'s word.

    Sharing Time: Why are Christians the light of the world?

  3. Be Ambassador of the Light

    Jesus is the Light of life and the world. He said, "I am the Way, the Truth, and the Life: no man cometh unto the Father, but by me" (John 14:6). If Jesus is the way, the truth, and the life what should we be? How can we represent the source of life, and light to mankind? Certainly with the implication of the teaching we can understand that we are to live as Christ and die as did Christ (Philippians 1:21). We must represent and present the way, the truth, and the life. Jesus saves people without our assistance, vicariously. We are the ambassadors of the Light today. When Jesus gave the Great Commission to the apostles, and Paul to Timothy, they were to go into the world and preach and teach the light of the gospel (Matthew 28:18-20; Mark 16:15-16; Luke 24:36-48; II Corinthians 4:4; II Timothy 4:1ff). Today, we represent the source of light in the world. Those who pervert the light are false ambassadors of the Light (Galatians 1:6-9). Those who mislead and misguide folks are the blind leaders of the blind! If we represent the Light of the world then we are the ambassadors of the Source of light.

    Sharing Time: How is the Light represented today?

Facilitator's Closing Remarks

Light helps us to see things. Jesus gives us the truth about God and life, our origin and our destiny. Light guides us as we travel. Jesus guides us safely through life to our heavenly home. Light promotes growth and life. Jesus brings us everlasting life. Light warms and comforts. Light prevents crime. Jesus is goodness itself. Light dispels darkness, which stands for evil. Jesus pierces the darkness of sin and death and conquers them. All the darkness in the world cannot overwhelm one candle flame. Jesus cannot be overcome by evil. We have the power to make a difference. Light will always overcome darkness, but it must be shining to make the difference. Is your light shining for Jesus? Do you have that light shining within? If so, it ought to shine through to others. If you do not possess the light, Jesus Christ desires to save you and give you His light!

Activity Period

  1. How can we represent the Source of life and Light to men?
  2. Will the world be a better place without the Light of the world (John 8:12)?

title: a reflector of god's glory
message:
SEPTEMBER WEEK 4

A REFLECTOR OF GOD'S GLORY

HYMN: BH 488 Mine Eyes Have Seen the Glory

SCRIPTURE: 2 Corinthians 3: 7-8, 17-18

Objectives :

By the end of the lesson, disciples should be able to:

  1. Discuss their understanding of God\'s glory.
  2. Appreciate themselves as reflectors of God\'s glory.

ICE BREAKING PERIOD: Question and Answer

Mention some ways you have seen some people manifesting and reflecting God\'s glory in their lives.

Facilitator's Opening Remarks

Believers are created for God's glory. He created humans in His glorious image, and all are formed according to the will of God, purposely to manifest His glory on earth. Those who are qualified to be called sons and daughters of God are the ones He created to manifest His glory. Therefore, it is our goal to reflect and manifest His glory in what we do as Christians

EDUCATION/INTERACTION PERIOD

God's plan for our lives is not so much in what we do as in what we are. God is concerned with the witness our life manifests to the world around us. Our life is constantly preaching messages to those around us and, it is not what we say that really matters often but our life's testimony; what people see us doing as Christians. The biblical word "witness," does not necessarily mean "to speak," but, rather, it has the meaning of our life being a reflection of God's glory to the world around us. It is as we develop insight into God's principles of living that our life will grow into a reflection of God's Son, Jesus Christ.

  1. His Glory

    Glory is the vehicle that conveys and reveals the true presence of God. In the Scripture, glory means possession of the character, beauty and majesty that belong to the Lord. It means an exact representation of His being. It means reflecting His presence, His essence, His life and His name. According to the Bible, to glorify God means to bring Christ\'s innate glory or radiance to light, to manifest it or to reflect it (John 17:1). To glorify God is to manifest all that God is. It is showing forth His Self and not our own. (John 14:13; 16:14) It\'s His glory brought to light in us. (John 11:4; 17:1, 5). It also means to be the vehicle that conveys and reveals the true presence of God. Everything designed by God is for His glory. All creation must acknowledge and give God glory. Ultimately, when we do not acknowledge the sovereignty of God it is indeed a serious violation of God\'s command. We are called to give God glory.

    Sharing Time: How can Christians reflect God\'s glory?

  2. Our Model

    In the New Testament, the word glory describes the revelation of the character, nature and presence of God in the Person of Christ (John 12:28). Jesus is God\'s glory. He is the manifestation of divine glory and He is the express image of God the Father. (Hebrews 1:3; John 17:5; John 1:i4; 2 Peter 1:17) He is the "King of Glory." During Christ\'s lifetime, He manifested the Father\'s image perfectly; expressing the Father\'s love to the Samaritan woman at the well and His compassion to the children He taught, His godly exhortation to His disciples and His rebuke to the Pharisees. In whatever Christ did, He glorified the Father. This, no doubt is the exact mission and purpose that Christ has for us. We are to glorify Him in all that we do (John 15:8). "I will glorify Thy Name for evermore" (Psalm 86:12). Jesus Christ is our role model of manifestation of God\'s glory to this world.

    Sharing Time: In what ways can those who have earthly hope reflect God\'s glory?

  3. Our Responsibility

    The Bible tells us that our creativity as human beings comes from being made in the image of the Master Creator (Genesis 1:27). We were created to manifest His glory (Isaiah 43:7). Glorifying God does not come automatically except we walk in the Spirit. Therefore, our primary purpose as Christians is to reflect God\'s glory rather than self. We must learn to obey and follow Him, be cleansed by His blood, filled with His Spirit and then walk by His Spirit, so that we can show forth His likeness to the world. To do otherwise is to be carnal, and carnal Christians primarily focus only on worldly things and do not do the will of God. They do not reflect the glory of God and are not transformed into Christ\'s glowing image and character. Our life's goal is to reflect God's glory through Christ to our world. Reflecting God's glory involves allowing God to take charge of our lives, and being the Chief Commander from whom we take instructions.

    Sharing Time: What are Satan's strategies to silent God's people so as not to manifest the glory of God in their lives?

Facilitator's Closing Remarks

Our lives should reflect the nature, attributes and character of the life of Jesus Christ. The Holy Spirit within us will give us the capability and strength we need to reflect the character of Jesus Christ. We are God\'s agents specifically called and designed to make His glory known everywhere we go. Each of us is wired to be "transformed into His likeness with ever-increasing glory." Day after day as we fellowship with one another, and focus on the things of God, we will shine brighter and brighter, and there will indeed be "ever-increasing glory." At the end of each day every one of us can think back over the day and see whether we have really fellowship with Christ and give ourselves to Him or not. If we do, we will have peace of mind. The world is a dark place and people need the light of Christ that we can shine into their lives. If we will focus on Christ, we can be that light and manifest God's glory.

Activity Period

  1. How do we reflect God's glory in our family, church and the contemporary society?
  2. Mention some ways you have manifested the glory of God in your workplace?

title: a channel of blessings
message:
SEPTEMBER WEEK 5

A CHANNEL OF BLESSINGS

HYMN: BH 438 Make Me a Channel of Blessing

SCRIPTURE: Deuteronomy 28:1-10

Objectives :

By the end of the lesson, disciples should be able to:

  1. Explain what it means to become a channel of blessings.
  2. List the benefits of one who is a channel of blessing.

ICE BREAKING PERIOD: Case Study

There was this young lady who was touched to give more than her tithe for the advancement of God\'s kingdom. During an altar call, she committed herself to give one-third of her income despite the fact that she was the breadwinner of her family with other responsibilities. In difficult times, she never let up. She persisted and continued to fulfill her commitment. On the account of her being faithful to her pledge, she never lacked anything. God provided for all her needs even above what she could have imagined or comprehended. In fact, at such a young age, she was already one of the managers in the company where she worked where most of her senior colleagues were predominantly males. But the biggest reward of all was the conversion of her whole family to true Christianity. "Will a mere mortal rob God" and use difficult period as excuse?

EDUCATION/INTERACTION PERIOD

  1. Do you know what it means to become a channel of God\'s blessings

    It simply means God is intentionally using you as an instrument to fulfil His plan and purpose. For example, if a television station is needed to reach out to millions of people for God to accomplish His agenda on earth, He will need a person as a channel to reach out.

    He created Man in His own image, commissioned him to rule, subdue and have dominion over the earth. He supplied all the resources that he needs. As you make moneythrough a business venture, or your profession or whatever work you may have, remember it is not by your strength. It is to be used for God\'s work that has been implanted in your heart. You must know that you are a channel to implement God's agenda on earth. He is simply giving you the opportunity to be part of His great work on earth. We must be available for God's use.

    Sharing Time: Have you ever wondered why God may not be blessing you as much as you think He should?

  2. How to be a Channel of Blessing

    Jesus said, "It is more blessed to give than to receive," Acts 20:35. Jesus is teaching that as disciples, we are more blessed when we learn how to share what we have with others. How can we do this?

    1. It requires a personal decision: Giving is a personal decision from the heart which must be between the giver and God. It does not matter what others are doing. We give out of the grace that has been extended to us by God. We give out of a personal love in our hearts for God. The grace giver gives even if nobody else does. What others do is not an issue. We become channels of blessing when we make conscious effort to give. God wants our giving to come from our heart, a willing heart that is in love with Him.

    2. Giving must become a regular practice: Paul said of the Philippians that they had a habit of giving (Philippians 4:10, 16). It was a practise in their lives that has become so important. Giving should be a regular grace that must be practiced systematically. The grace of giving is far too important to a Spirit-filled believer to treat in a casual, flippant way. You are giving to your Lord and Saviour, the One who saved you from eternal condemnation, redeemed you, and changed your life. The Bible says you need to show your love for Him in this way (2 Corinthians 8:8, 24).

    3. Trust Christ to give through you: Giving can easily become a work of the flesh. Only Jesus Christ working in and through us can save and deliver us from hypocritical giving and cultural trappings of materialism and greed. We are saved by His amazing grace. Giving is the normal and natural response of a person that is walking in a close relationship with Jesus Christ. It is a fruit of that relationship. The key to the Philippians\' giving hearts is that they yielded themselves to Christ who lived in them. The gracious and giving heart of the Saviour was manifesting in and through them and they became channels of blessing to others (2 Corinthians 8:2-5).

  3. Benefits of becoming a Channel of Blessing

    In fact, innumerable and immeasurable benefits come from being a channel of God\'s blessings. They include the following:

    1. Partaking of the fruit of His blessings: Even though part of what you earn may be used for the ministry God intended you to have, most part of it is used personally by you and your loved ones.  Hence, you get to enjoy it and live happily.  What is amazing is that the more you give, the more you receive and the more you give, the more you need to give.  You can never outgive God.

    2.  Eternal benefit is guaranteed: Once life is ended, you will be rest assured that your eternal life is guaranteed as long as you are in Christ.

    3.  God's works in your life serve as channel of blessings: As you serve the Lord, He works amazingly in your life. Greater blessings abound both in this world and in the ages to come. God as a father delights in giving back to His generous children much more than the value of the gift that was offered to Him.  He loves a cheerful giver and this expression of cheerful giving becomes a sweet aroma to Him. God is a generous God.  His nature is to give.  He has not withheld anything that is good.  God desires and expects you to open your heart and hand to reach out to others, to become a channel of God\'s blessings. 

    Sharing Time: Explain the difference between a Christian who is a reservoir of God\'s blessings, and the one who is a channel of God\'s blessings?

ROAD MAP FOR DISCIPLES

To live as a Christian requires having the character of Christ. A transformation must occur as a result of the Holy Spirit\'s indwelling. Our transformed lives compel us to share the gospel to let others have eternal life. Christ\'s disciple is one who loves God with all he has. Christ\'s disciple, by God\'s grace, becomes more like Christ through a life of faith and obedience. Choosing to make Jesus Christ the Lord of our life changes our lifestyle dramatically. Our lifestyle has the tendency to influence others either positively or negatively; for good or evil. The strong can influence the weak for good or the weak can influence the strong for evil. Also, the fruit we bear affects our influence and vice versa. Our lifestyle should lend credence to what we profess and respectability to the truths we believe. Disciple\'s lifestyle should never become a list of rules but imitating the Master must be our focus and priority. It is expedient to focus on Jesus Christ, the Author and Finisher of our faith rather on rules and regulations.

title: the concept of politics
message:
OCTOBER WEEK 1

THE CONCEPT OF POLITICS

HYMN: BH 425 I\'ll Go Where You Want Me to Go

SCRIPTURE: Isaiah 6: 5-8

Objectives :

By the end of the lesson, members should be able to:

  1. Express why they need to go for elective positions.
  2. Make a commitment to get involved and to be light there.
  3. Pray for those who are willing to get involved, and claim Isaiah 54:17 for them.

ICE BREAKING PERIOD: Discussion

We thank God for keeping Nigeria united and for the uninterrupted democracy since 1999 in spite of daunting challenges. Let members mention names of governors in their geo-political zones. Why did people vote for them? Is it because of religious, tribal or ethnic sentiments? Aside from that, how many Christians are involved in community, Church, professional/market politics?

Facilitator's Opening Remarks

A French jurist once said, "In every human group, from the smallest to the largest, from the most ephemeral to the most stable, there are those who command and those who obey, those who give orders and those who comply with them, those who make decisions and those who abide by them." The above quotation refers to the governor and the governed. For clarity sake, elected political functionaries in positions of authority at the local, state, national community, professional/market levels are the governors while the masses of the people are the governed. It is therefore a serious matter that few Christians now participate in politics in our country; even in their community.

EDUCATION/INTERACTION PERIOD

We often look at politics as a special area designed for a special class of people. How do we often see politicians? What name do you often call them? We have seen situations where some Christians break relationship with their fellow Christians just because their friends have been elected into political offices. What is wrong?

  1. Understanding Politics

    Various definitions have been given by various authors on what politics is. One author, Harold Lasswell, agrees with another author Robert Dahl that, "Politics is about who gets what, when and how." Another author David Easton sees politics as the authoritative allocation of values." Do you agree? Who decides who becomes a minister, or a commissioner? Who allocates portfolios? Who determines where a constituency project should be cited or who become his advisers? These, among other powers, belong to elected politicians. Even, the Nigerian Baptist Convention or conference, who determines who should be sponsored for overseas courses? The list is endless. Does who get what, when and how sound meaningful to you? That is politics.

  2. Christians Who Oppose Participation in Politics

    A number of Christians believe that anyone in party politics should be tagged, "Born Against" or "Dead Christians". They believe such people have left the light to embrace darkness where fraudsters, occultists, and other perpetrators of societal vices reside. They often cite Revelation 3:1"… I know your deeds, you have a reputation of being alive, but you are dead" as their anchor. Some other Christians who refuse to participate regard politics as dirty or evil. Their thinking is that a Christian will not be able to isolate him/herself from dubious people citing 1 Corinthians 15:33, "Do not be misled, `Bad company corrupts good character,\'" for support. Martins Luther Jr said "The world is full of evil, not because of those who do evil but because of those who sit and let it happen." As Christians, can you make sense out of this?

    Sharing Time: Mention other reasons some Christians refuse to participate in politics. What can be done to change the perspective of Christians running away from active politics?

  3. Christians Who Support Participation in Politics

    Christians who believe in participating in politics assert that it is not possible to have dominion over all if they refuse to participate. They further argue that to be salt and light in this perversed world of darkness, Christians cannot afford to fold their arms. Matthew 5:13-14 says "You are the salt of the earth. But if the salt loses its saltiness, how can it be made salty again? It is no longer good for anything, except to be thrown out and trampled by men. You are the light of the world. A city on a hill cannot be hidden."

    Sharing Time: Mention other reasons some Christians believe in participating in politics? How can we support Christians in politics? What can the Church and the denominational leaders do to encourage their members?

Facilitator's Closing Remarks

We should not be scared when people are discussing politics. We do not have separate country for Christians, Muslims, and traditional worshippers. We have to continue to live together. We should not allow fear to dominate our mentality and perception about politics.

Activity Period

  1. Are you among those who are against Christians participating in politics? This is the time to do a rethink.
  2. Ask God to open your eyes to what you can do as a church or denomination in Nigerian politics.

title: the different levels of politics
message:
OCTOBER WEEK 2

THE DIFFERENT LEVELS OF POLITICS

HYMN: BH 319 Higher Ground

SCRIPTURE: Zechariah 4:6-7

Objectives :

By the end of the lesson, members should be able to:

  1. Recognise the different levels of politics.
  2. Decide to actively participate in one level of politics or the other.

ICE BREAKING PERIOD: Question and Answer

Is it everyone who contests in an election that wins and occupies the various positions? (Let members give reasons for their answer). As Christians, we must be able to make our marks politically at the level where we have comparative advantage.

Facilitator's Opening Remarks

Today's topic is to guide Christians who are politically conscious to know where they can be relevant taking into consideration their Christian virtues, and other personal credentials, including mutual relationship with people. If it is party politics, they must register with a political party that the electoral body recognises. They must know the philosophy or manifesto of such party. They must have voters\' card and ensure they pay their taxes to the government as at when due. If it is professional, market, church, community or even student politics, they must be of proven character and untainted integrity.

EDUCATION/INTERACTION PERIOD

  1. Some Levels of Politics Opened to a Contestant Seeking Election

    In Nigeria\'s party politics for instance, the various levels opened to a contestant are the elections to local, state and national positions. Since the constitution of the Federal Republic of Nigeria allows for fundamental human rights of association, freedom to worship and freedom of movement, among others, it becomes pertinent to say that politics exists in professional, market, community associations and even in the Church. All these will be examined so that we can understand at which level we have comparative advantage. We need to stress that the levels for contestants are not compartmentalised. It is possible for one to move even from being a local government political functionary to becoming a senator, speaker, governor, etc under a registered political party if he/she has interest, capacity and capability.

  2. Local Government Level

    Politics at the Local Government level is the nearest to the electorate. The functions of a local government council include construction, maintenance and regulation of roads, streets, street lighting, drains, naming of roads and streets as well as numbering of houses among others. Offices open for contest at the local government level include that of the chairman and councilors.

    Sharing Time: How effective is your local government council in terms of service delivery? How would you rate elected officers of your local government in terms of performance? How many of the elected officers are Christians? How would you encourage them?

  3. State Assembly Level

    The State Assembly has provision for the selection of a Speaker and a Deputy Speaker among members of the House. The State Assembly has the power to make laws exercised by bills passed and assented to by the governor of the state. The House of Assembly has power to make laws for the peace, order and good governance of the state. It also has power to confirm state commissioners among other functions.

    Sharing Time: Let us answer these questions: Where is the location of the House of Assembly in your state? Have you ever been to that House? Who is the Speaker? Who is the Deputy Speaker? How many members are in that House and how many of them are Christians? How effective is the House of Assembly in terms of performance?

  4. National Assembly

    The constitution of Nigeria says there shall be a National Assembly for the federation which shall consist of a Senate and a House of Representatives. The Senate shall consist of three senators from each state and one from the Federal Capital Territory, Abuja. By mathematical calculation, how many senators are in the National Assembly as approved by the nation\'s constitution? Likewise, the House of Representatives shall consist of three hundred and sixty members representing constituencies of nearly equal population. There shall be a President and a Deputy President of the Senate who shall be elected by members of that House. Also, there shall be a Speaker and a Deputy Speaker of the House of Representatives who shall be elected by the members of the House. The National Assembly, that is the Senate and House of Representatives, shall have power to make laws for the peace, order and good government of the federation. It has power to confirm ministers, ambassadors, approve budgets, among other powers.

  5. Executive Level

    In party politics, under democracy in Nigeria, the executive levels are those of the state governors and president of the Federal Republic of Nigeria. The state executive governor and his deputy are elected under a party platform. The whole state is the constituency of a governor and deputy on a joint ticket. The governor has the power to appoint commissioners and key public officers; to present budget and other functions assigned to him under the constitution. The executive power of the federation is vested in the president who is elected along with a vice on a joint ticket and a party platform. The whole country is his constituency. The president has power to appoint ministers, ambassadors and other functions assigned by the constitution.

  6. Other Levels of Political Participation

    Aside from political party contests, there are other levels where politics is played secretly or publicly. These other levels also have manifestoes to win elections within the groups and among their members following their constitutions. These include professional bodies like Nigeria Medical Association, Nigerian Society of Engineers, the Nigeria Union of Journalists, among others. The various market associations, transport unions, trade organisations, communities and towns elect executives to run their affairs. All these associations and unions are registered by the Corporate Affairs Commission (CAC) and they can sue or be sued. All these associations and unions are recognised by governments within their areas of jurisdiction but those that are national in membership are recognised by all governments and Houses of Assembly of the federation.

  7. Politics at the Church Level

    This is not lumped with politics at the professional and trade union levels because of its relevance to Christians. The Church is not the building but the called out ones who have surrendered their lives to Jesus, confessed and repented of their sins. In essence, they are the saved ones. Each church denomination has a constitution and because politics has to do with the activities, ideas, debates, and relationship of human beings for good administration and orderliness, there is politics in the Church. Church politics in some cases have led to strong unification of members while on the other hand, church politics has led to factionalism and breakaway.

    Sharing Time: Can you share your experience of politics within a church known to you? Why must there be politics in the house of God? Name some active politicians in your church. How do you relate with them?

Facilitator's Closing Remarks

From today's study, we can see how many levels of politics are available for Christians to actively participate. We live in a political world and we should not be marginalised. Our youth should be involved in student union politics with the mind of Christ. We sincerely need to pray for the empowerment of the Holy Spirit to be more involved in politics.

Activity Period

  1. Close to you, is a landlord association, are you a member of the executive?
  2. In that professional body to which you belong, are you a member of the executive?
  3. Pray for the politicians in your church and continue to encourage them by giving them support.

title: god's expectations of christ's disciples in politics
message:
OCTOBER WEEK 3

GOD'S EXPECTATIONS OF CHRIST'S DISCIPLES IN POLITICS

HYMN: BH 412 Onward Christian Soldiers

SCRIPTURE: Isaiah 40:28-31

Objectives :

By the end of the lesson, members should be able to:

  1. State what God expects from Christians in politics.
  2. Explain how they can make a difference.

ICE BREAKING PERIOD: Opinion Sharing

Let class members discuss or explain who can be termed Christ\'s disciples in the contemporary world. This should last for only five minutes.

Facilitator's Opening Remarks

The message of the Gospel is that by grace through faith, sinners can be reconciled to God (Ephesians 2:7-8). This message transforms individuals and enables them to lead godly lives. Mandated by the Scripture (Matthew 28:19-20), Christians are charged to share the goodnews and disciple others in the faith. The Gospel is a holistic message with implications for all areas of life, including how Christians can engage in the political process. God's expectation from believers in Christ is great, to be an influential personality even in politics.

EDUCATION/INTERACTION PERIOD

  1. Christ's Disciples Should Be Concerned about Politics

    Here are some reasons why Christians should be concerned about politics:

    1. Christ' disciples' worldview speaks to all areas of life: It speaks to all areas of life, including political engagement. In fact, the Bible speaks about civil government and provides examples of faithful engagement.

    2. Politics is inescapable: Augustine's City of God offers guidance on this point. Believers are citizens of the "City of God", but on this side of eternity, we also belong to the "City of Man" and therefore must be good citizens of both cities. This reality makes politics inescapable for Christ\'s disciples as it concerns who control their political future.

    3. Christ\'s disciples need to love their neighbour: In a very real sense of neighbourliness, politics is one of the most important areas in which Christians demonstrate love to neighbours. Loving a neighbour includes volunteering at a homeless shelter, as well as influencing laws that encourage human flourishing.

    4. Government war against evil and promotes good: Government derives its authority from God to promote good and restrain evil. This mandate is expressly stated in Romans 13:1-7. Christian witness in the public square contributes transcendent values about moral and ethical issues. Politics affects government, shapes society and influences culture. Because of what the Bible teaches and the inevitability of its effect on our culture, Christians must care about politics.

    Sharing Time: What are the things Christians in politics should do away with?

  2. What Christ's Disciples Should Remember about Politics

    There are four things to remember about politics which serve as guide for Christ's disciples.

    1. Remember the Bible enjoins us to obey the laws of the land. There is no doubt that our responsibility to government is to obey the laws and be good citizens (Romans 13:1-2). God has established all authority, and He does so for our benefit, "to commend those who do right" (1Peter 2:13-15). Paul tells us in Romans 13:1-8 that it is the government's responsibility to rule in authority over us hopefully for our good to collect taxes, and to keep the peace. Where we have a voice and can elect our leaders, we should exercise that right by voting for those who best demonstrate Christian principles.

    2. Remember the Bible tells us to pray for our governing authorities (1Timothy 2:1-4) and to respect those in authority (Romans 13:1-7). God commands us to pray for our leaders to rule well as such prayer is good and welcomed before God our Saviour.

    3. Remember Christ must be Lord of our political views. That may sound obvious, but it is anything but obvious in practice. People whose lives are otherwise in submission to Christ have a tendency to forget about His lordship when the subject turns to politics. They have not thought through what the Bible says about politics and our involvement in that area. But if Christ is Lord of all of life and if the Bible speaks about political matters, then we must allow Him to be Lord of our political views.

    4. Christian politicians must remember that their duty to the Lord must take precedence over the duties of their office. Paul tells us that whatever we do, we are to do it for the glory of the Lord, not our own (1 Corinthians 10:31; Colossians 3:17). If a Christian does seek office, it should only be if he can faithfully execute the duties of that office to the glory of God and without compromising Christian principles.

    Sharing Time: What are other things Christians in politics should remember?

Facilitator's Closing Remarks

Christian witness in the public contributes transcendent values about moral and ethical issues. Christian withdrawal opens a moral vacuum susceptible to influences that pressure government to move outside the purview designated by God. Politics affects government, shapes society and influences culture. Because of what the Bible teaches and the inevitability of its effect on our culture, Christians must be concerned about politics and remember the heavenly home, whatever they do in politics.

Activity Period

  1. Shouldn't God's people be instrumental in influencing elections?
  2. Should the pulpit be used for campaigning for particular political party in church, where we have different members in different political parties?

title: christians' mandate to support christian political leaders
message:
OCTOBER WEEK 4

CHRISTIANS' MANDATE TO SUPPORT CHRISTIAN POLITICAL LEADERS

HYMN: BH 406 Fight the Good Fight

SCRIPTURE: 2 Corinthians 10:4-6

Objectives :

By the end of the lesson, members should be able to:

  1. Mention at least four reasons why they support Christians in political leadership.
  2. Give various ways they can support Christian political leaders.

ICE BREAKING PERIOD: Sharing Opinion

Lead class members to mention Christians who have occupied political leadership in the past in Nigeria. How many of them have been in executive positions before and how relevant are they now?

Facilitator's Opening Remarks

Those in political offices hold power to make decisions, rules and make laws for the good governance of the society. Often, we hear people murmuring, grumbling, complaining and crying aloud because their expectations were not met by those in positions of authority. Who do we blame? The Bible says in Proverbs 29:2, "When the righteous are in authority the people rejoice, but when the wicked rule, the people mourn."

EDUCATION/INTERACTION PERIOD

  1. Why We Should Support Christians in Political Leadership

    Contemporary disciples of Christ need to give strong support to Christian brothers and sisters in political leadership because:

    1. Their presence in politics means a lot to our professed faith. If they fail, we Christians also fail.

    2. They are Christ\'s representatives and our representatives as well.

    3. Many of them have good intention for their country before they got there, but on getting there, they are faced with different challenges from their non-Christian counterparts which prevent them from carrying out their good intentions.

    4. Much is expected of them because all eyes are on them to see if they will perform well.

  2. How to Support Christians in Political Leadership

    A number of Christians in the Church today read the Bible daily but their application is theoretical rather than practical. Galatians 6:10 says, "Therefore, as we have opportunity, let us do good to all people, especially those who belong to the family of believers." The Church is made up of academics, the technocrats, the singles, the unemployed, the traders and professionals, etc. who are thirsty for messages from all available channels of the Church to give them direction and transform their lives. If our mandate is to support Christian political leaders, we should not be in the dark or be ignorant but consciously use the following channels.

    1. Pulpit Channel: A number of our ministers are afraid to use the pulpit to discuss politics except during national day celebrations. Their fear could be understood. They think the only assignment they have is to direct the congregation to heaven without earthly relevance in socio-economic and political realms. This should not be so. The mere fact that politics is preached as a message does not translate that the whole Church is being sold to a single party in a nation that runs a multi-party system. Pastors should therefore preach it on the pulpit for members of their congregations to know that it is their responsibility to support Christians in political positions. The congregations should be made to know that such Christian political leaders have gone there to represent the entire body of Christ.

    2. Use of Various Groups in the Church: A number of denominations have different groups through which education and enlightenment could be given on why Christian political leaders should be supported. In the Baptist denomination in Nigeria, such groups include the MMU, WMU, Youths, Student Fellowship, Lydia, Royal Ambassadors and so on. These groups can disseminate information on current political affairs.

    3. Denominational Literature: The various denominational literatures could be used to promote political participation at least once in a year. Learning is a continuous process and knowledge has no limit.

    4. Church Library: Essential documents that are absent in most libraries are the Constitution of the Federal Republic of Nigeria and Electoral Act. The church library should not be filled up with biblical literature only but also with newspapers, magazines and cuttings from topical political issues and editorials.

    5. Debate: Debates are necessary to propel cross-fertilisation of ideas. Such issues are \'Should women participate in politics? Who is a good manager of resourcesmen or women? Which is better two party system or multi-party system?\' This kind of forum will further stimulate the consciousness of the congregation on politics.

Facilitator's Closing Remarks

Christians view politics from different perspectives because of perceived dangers in it but can we stand aloof? Professor Yusuf Ameh Obaje, a renowned Baptist in his book, " Politics in God\'s own House" has this to say, "Let it be known here that God is a politician, Jesus is a politician; therefore all Christians must go into it to show people that there is light in politics. Do not be afraid of politics. We who are called by His name must not run away from politics."

Activity Period

  1. Mention some Christians, particularly of Baptist denomination, who have been or are still actively involved in politics and are holding key positions in Nigeria.
  2. How much support and encouragement do you give them?

ROAD MAP FOR DISCIPLES

The story of creation as recorded in Genesis Chapter One shows God as the God of order. He created everything on earth, under the earth and above the earth. After creation, He said everything He had created was very good (Genesis 1:31). But before that, God, in Genesis 1:26 said, `\'Let us make man in our image, in our likeness to rule over other creatures." Genesis 1:28 highlights the assignments given to Man. God did not say a particular gender or adherent of a particular religion should have dominion over all His creatures.

On dominance, Roman 13:1 says, "Everyone must submit himself to the governing authorities, for there is no authority except that which God has established. The authorities that exist have been established by God". As Christians, why do we not enter into politics and positions of authority politically? Why are we so complacent? Have we resigned to fate and joined A.G.I.P, that is, Any Government In Power? Whatever the situation, Christians should get involved in politics first, as a voter, second, as a party member and third, as a contestant. In all cases, we need God\'s directive. Psalm 32:8 says, "I will instruct you and teach you in the way you should go; I will counsel you and watch over you."

You have studied for the past four weeks "Disciples and Political Issues", now it is time to reflect

1. As light, where should believers show light?

2. Satan uses various strategies to win people to his side. If as a believer, someone gives you five million naira to help his victory at the polls, how will you react?

3. Look at your own Church, how many members are politically active and how much support do you give them?

4. Does your pastor shy away from preaching on politics and how can you be of help to him in this direction?

5. Look at Christian Association of Nigeria (CAN), how effective is it in sensitising Christians on politics?

6. What else can you say on politics that can be of help to Christians to actively participate in politics?

7. Read aloud Proverbs 28:12.

title: give thanks for the gift of life
message:
NOVEMBER WEEK 1

GIVE THANKS FOR THE GIFT OF LIFE

HYMN: BH 43 Immortal, Invisible

SCRIPTURE: James 1:17-18

Objectives :

By the end of the lesson, members should be able to:

  1. Mention the reasons why they should give thanks to God for the gift of life.
  2. Respond to God with thankfulness for the gift of life.

ICE BREAKING PERIOD:

Give opportunity to at least two people to share their understanding about life. Allow them to link their understanding to reasons why believers should thank God for the gift of life.

Facilitator's Opening Remarks

One of the most seditious lies of Satan is that we own everything. This view often leads to thanklessness and looking down on someone or everyone. It is exceedingly difficult to be thankful if we do not stop to remember all that God has been doing for us. When we forget what God has done, we feel entitled to what we have. We are to be thankful to God.

EDUCATION/INTERACTION PERIOD

  1. Recognising the Giver of Life

    Life is a precious gift from God. He gave us good and perfect life. He is the ultimate giver of life (James 1:17). When we openly thank God as the giver of life, we begin to gain true perspective on both the gift and the giver. We gain a reputation for being happy in the joy of the Lord and naturally want to draw other people in to share what we have. Paul\'s message in Acts 17:24-25 presents it this way: "The God who made the world and everything in it, being Lord of heaven and earth, does not live in temples made by man, nor is he served by human hands, as though he needed anything, since he himself gives to all mankind life and breath and everything." Jesus in John 11 wants us to recognise God as the giver of life through the miracle of raising Lazarus. Jesus gave thanks to God from an essential understanding of who He is, and because He wants others to know Him too. In turn, we can give thanks to God because we know who He is and who we are in relationship with Him. He is the Giver and Sustainer of Life.

    Sharing Time: What are reasons why some recognise creatures than the Creator?

  2. Reasons for Thanking God for the Gift of Life

    Life is a pilgrimage: The concept of pilgrimage is tremendously important to the Christian, giving guidance on the believer\'s stance in all circumstances of life. Without this concept, we become ingrates, unable to give thanks to God and unnecessarily sensitive to all the problems and trials of life. Jacob spoke of `the days of my pilgrimage in Genesis 47:7-10; the heroes of faith in Hebrews 11 declared by their lifestyle that they were strangers and pilgrims on earth. This concept should ignite in every believer a response of thanksgiving to God the giver of life.

    Life is ephemeral: The time of life is short. In fact, life is a tenure and temporary. The lamentation of Moses on brevity of human life becomes intelligible and appropriate for thanksgiving. The truth according to Psalm 90 is that times flies and life is short! Each of us needs to give thanks to God and evaluate how we use the precious gift of life. Regarding each day as a valuable gift of God should spur us to give thanks to Him. Jacob alluded to the time of life in Genesis 47:9, `\'…My year has been few…\'\'

    Life is preserved by God: Believers in Christ Jesus should not only remain grateful to God for the assurance that He is going to preserve us,but for the preservation we had enjoyed from Him. By preserving us, God maintained in safety from injury, peril, or harm. The preservation of God in our lives is like an insurance policy God has taken out on our behalf. God is the ultimate insurance policy for believers! He does not only preserve but elongates our lives, (Deuteronomy 30:20). This calls for thanksgiving (Psalm 121:7-8). That the Lord is always actively working to preserve us in the face of challenges of life and from all evil is a good reason to thank Him.

    Life is valuable to God: Our response of thanksgiving to Him should recognise that life is valuable to God. We are commanded to recognise the great value of human life in Exodus 20:13, "You shall not murder." May God help us to give Him thanks that show truly we His image in all those with whom we share the common grace of His breath of life.

    Life is an assignment from God: Christ\'s disciples should understand that life is an assignment from God. It is necessary to daily appreciate God for accomplishing one or other works He has given to us to do on earth. As we work on what He has given us then our lifestyle must be an attitude of thanksgiving.

    Sharing Time: Why is it so difficult for some people to give thanks to God when they receive answers to prayer?

Facilitator's Closing Remarks

Life is a gift of God that every believer in Christ must value by giving thanks to Him. We must give thanks to God by respecting other people's by making our lives a channel of blessing to others and ultimately by submitting our lives to serve Him. Our continuous response to God in thanksgiving for His gift of life should be, `'Take my life and let it be consecrated, Lord to thee'' (Frances R. Havergal, BH 357).

Activity Period

  1. Do you wait till November annual thanksgiving before giving thanks to God?
  2. Why are some people not living a lifestyle of thanksgiving?

title: give thanks for the gift of salvation
message:
NOVEMBER WEEK 2

GIVE THANKS FOR THE GIFT OF SALVATION

HYMN: BH 41 To God Be the Glory

SCRIPTURE: 2 Thessalonians 2:13, Ephesians 2:8-9

Objectives :

By the end of the lesson, members should be able to:

  1. State the reasons why they should give thanks to God for the gift of salvation.
  2. Appraise their thanksgiving for the gift of salvation.

ICE BREAKING PERIOD:

Give opportunity to at least two people who can confidently share their salvation experience. Allow one or two people to also explain what it really means to appreciate God for His gift of salvation.

Facilitator's Opening Remarks

It is so easy in this troubled life to overlook the value of salvation. The longer a person has known Christ the greater the temptation to take salvation for granted and to forget the tragedy of what it is like to be lost. Salvation is a free gift of God. As we consider how to give thanks to God for His salvation, let us rejoice in the Lord and delight in His salvation (Psalm 35:9).

EDUCATION/INTERACTION PERIOD

  1. Thanking God for the Gift of Salvation

    Salvation is achieved by God alone: Our entire salvation, from first to last, is due to God alone, "the author and finisher of our faith\'\' (Hebrews 12:2), for from Him and to Him and through Him are all things…and, therefore, all the praise, glory, thanks and honour for our new life is to be given to God alone. We must conclude that it is not scriptural to thank and praise God for 95 per cent of salvation, and then give man the credit for the remaining 5 per cent. If God is thanked for man\'s new life in Christ, it must be because He alone is perceived as responsible for it (Ephesians 2:8-9).

    Salvation is grounded entirely on what Christ has done for us: Our salvation is grounded entirely on what Christ has done for us. What we could not produce or provide (faith and obedience), Jesus produced and provided for us. It is based solely on Jesus\' saving work that we should thank God, a work done entirely outside and external to us. First, salvation is grounded on Christ\'s work of atonement. We are "being justified as a gift by His grace through the redemption which is in Christ Jesus" (Romans 3:24 NASB). The design of the gospel is to magnify God\'s glory and this is done to the greatest degree by a free, justifying grace. This work of salvation in Christ Jesus calls for thanksgiving to God. This is because, it is done when man\'s involvement is entirely excluded, when man is entirely debased (Romans 5:8).

    Our living hope in our great salvation: Another reason the believer should thank God for salvation is because God has brought us into a living hope. If your hope is built on the economy of a nation, your career, your family, or your investments, it will come to nothing. The economy is shaky at best; one could lose his career or retirement comes. Life as we know it will eventually come to an end. These are dead hopes because one day they will come to nothing. Yet these are the only hopes that the world can really have. But he who have been saved through faith in Christ have a hope that will last forever (I John 2:17). The living hope in Christ Jesus through the grace of salvation calls for thanksgiving to God (I Peter 1:3).

    Sharing Time: What shall we render unto our God who has lavishly given Jesus Christ, His only begotten Son to save mankind?

  2. We Have an Inheritance in Our Great Salvation

    The inheritance in the Old Covenant was perishable. The temple was destroyed along with the building and the walls. It was polluted with sin and the idolatry of the nation. It was prone to decay because it was temporal and not eternal. However, the inheritance of the believer in the New Covenant is much greater than that of the Old Covenant. It is imperishable, undefiled, unfading and it is being reserved in heaven by God. This is something to thank God for because in this life our inheritance is temporal at best. The money we save fluctuates in value with the economy; it is prone to be lost, but not our inheritance in heaven (Matthew 6:19-20). Christians are co-heirs with Christ. Everything that is Christ\'s is ours (Romans 8:17). However, the greatest part of our inheritance is God. He is our portion, He is our joy, and in heaven we will have unhindered fellowship with Him (Psalms 73:26; 16:5). The saints should thank God because of this inheritance that is waiting for them in heaven. Thank you Lord!

  3. The Future Aspect of Our Salvation

    This may sound strange to some because we are already saved. However, the Scripture talks about salvation in at least three ways: justification in the past (Ephesians 2:8), sanctification in the present (Philippians 2:12-13), and glorification when we see Christ and have our resurrected bodies (I Peter 1:5, I John 3:2). This is something we should get excited about and thank God for. There is a day coming when we will no longer wrestle with pride, fight against lust or temptation. One day, we will be completely like Christ and until that time, we fight and "work out our salvation" so we can look more and more like our Lord. This future aspect of our salvation should excite us to give thanks to God. We should thank God because he is retaining this for us.

  4. Protection over Our Great Salvation

    Believers should thank God for His protection over our great salvation. The believer\'s salvation is secure. This should make us thank God (I Peter 1:5). Our salvation is eternal. It cannot be lost because Christ is active, and God is active in guarding it like a soldier. There is nobody better to guard your salvation than God. You can have ultimate confidence that Christ will lose none (John 18:7-9). Our God guards the faith of the saints. Our thanksgiving to God should recognise the fact that each believer is called to make their election sure by growing in their faith so that they no longer will be tossed to and fro at every temptation or failure (2 Peter 1:10; Ephesians 4:14).

    Sharing Time: Why do some believers still offer animal sacrifice for their salvation apart from what God has done for mankind in Jesus Christ?

Facilitator's Closing Remarks

If you have experienced God\'s salvation through Jesus Christ, then you should be filled with joy and thanksgiving. You should be able to say, "You are my God, and I give thanks to You... Give thanks to the LORD, for He is good; For His lovingkindness is everlasting" (Psalm 118:28-29 NASB).

Activity Period

  1. Why do so many people lack assurance of salvation? Substantiate your answer with reasons.
  2. How can we keep the joy of salvation, especially when going through trials?

title: give thanks for the gift of provision
message:
NOVEMBER WEEK 3

GIVE THANKS FOR THE GIFT OF PROVISION

HYMN: BH 18 Praise, My Soul, the King of Heaven

SCRIPTURE: Psalms 68:10-19

Objectives :

By the end of the lesson, members should be able to:

  1. List various ways through which God provides for us.
  2. Use the provision to bless others.

ICE BREAKING PERIOD: Sharing

Let each member share their experience on how God provided for their needs. Each of these experiences should be linked to the lesson.

Facilitator's Opening Remarks

Our God is God of abundant provisions that cannot run dry. He is El-Shaddai, the Almighty. He has given every of His disciples all that we need for life and godliness. So, we have reasons to thank Him for meeting all our spiritual, emotional and material needs. The following lessons on God\'s provision should spur us to give thanks to God.

EDUCATION/INTERACTION PERIOD

  1. God Provides Abundantly for All Our Needs

    Our heavenly Father deserves to receive our thanksgiving. This is because He knows and abundantly provides for all our needs. These needs may include:

    1. Material needs. We do not have a `divine right\' to prosperity, as some have falsely taught. But neither do we need to feel guilty about the material things God provides for us. We should hold these things lightly, giving thanks, and remembering that they belong to God, not to us (Exodus 8:10). We are just manager for Him, not owners. To whom much is given, much is required (Luke 12:48). We need not to be ungrateful for His provision. When God blesses us materially we can thankfully enjoy the things He has richly supplied (Philippians 4:19).

    2. Emotional needs. God is good and we owe Him gratitude for providing for our emotional needs. God wants us to be emotionally whole. He does not always do it instantly or when we think He should. He often does it by bringing healing to relationships with family members and others who have hurt us. But even if they never respond, the Lord teaches us how to forgive and to have our emotional needs met in Him. We must thank Him for this provision. The fruit of the Spirit (Galatians 5:22-23) describes an emotionally whole person. Fruit takes time to grow, but every believer who walks in the Spirit is promised that fruit of emotional wholeness (3 John 2).

    3. Spiritual needs. God\'s ultimate goal is always spiritual. We must thank Him because He always has a spiritual reason behind any material blessings He supplied or withholds. God is shaping us to be channels to convey His blessings to lost people. To do that, He has provided abundantly in Christ for all of our spiritual needs, even when we are not aware of them. We must thank Him for making provision for our spiritual needs (Ephesians 1:3; 2 Peter 1:3).

    Sharing Time: Why are some stingy in giving generously to others as God meets their needs abundantly on daily basis?

  2. God Provides for Our Needs in His Timing, Not Ours

    Another lesson about God\'s provision that provides another reason to give thanks to God is the provision of God for our needs in His timing (Ecclesiastes 3:11). God provides for our needs in His timing, not ours. Let us appreciate Him and give Him thanks because His time is always perfect and beautiful. God abundantly provides for our every need, but He doesn\'t necessarily do it just when we think He should. He does it in His time, often letting us come to the very edge, so that we will learn to trust in Him (2 Corinthians1:8-9). To God be the glory!

    Sharing Time: Why is it is so difficult for some believers to wait for God\'s time to answer their prayers?

  3. God Provides for Us through Grace, and Not Merit

    God does not bless us because we are such deserving people. He blesses us because of His Son, Jesus. If we are in Him, then we have got connections in high places! He provides blessings for us often when we have not trusted Him as we should. Why? Because of our relationship with Jesus. God even took our sin, which sent Jesus to the cross, and used the cross as the means of our salvation. Where sin abounded, grace abounded all the more (Romans 5:20). Why did Pharaoh provide so abundantly for Jacob and his eleven sons? It certainly was not because they were wonderful people .Jacob\'s sons should not have been blessed because of the way they had treated their brother and father. But they were blessed anyway, apart from any merit on their part, because of their relationship with Joseph. God took their act of sin, selling their own brother into slavery, and made it the means of their deliverance from famine. God doesn't bless us because we are such deserving people. For this reason, we should respond to His provision through thanksgiving.

    Sharing Time: Why do we need to "give thanks in all circumstances?

Facilitator's Closing Remarks

As Christ's disciples, we must always reflect on the Lord\'s provision in meeting all our needs, we will see that God is worthy to receive our thanks and praises. Disciples of Jesus must be thankful in all situations whether bearable or unbearable because He is our "Jehovah-Jireh", God, our Provider.

Activity Period

How do we explain giving thanks for God's abundant provision to a person who seemingly didn't receive it when he needed it? Give at least two practical ways through which our thanksgiving can be expressed and improved as Christ's disciples.

title: give thanks for the gift of protection
message:
NOVEMBER WEEK 4

GIVE THANKS FOR THE GIFT OF PROTECTION

HYMN: BH 40 A Mighty Fortress Is Our God

SCRIPTURE: Psalm 125:1-2

Objectives :

By the end of the lesson, members should be able to:

  1. Mention reasons why they should thank God for His gift of protection.
  2. Demonstrate their trust in God's protection.

ICE BREAKING PERIOD: Sharing

Encourage and allow members to share the story of God's protection upon their lives.

Facilitator's Opening Remarks

God is a faithful Protector. He protects us from all dangers of life. You can trust Him to protect you from everything as He has promised. God\'s providence is His Almighty and ever present power, whereby as with His hand, He still upholds heaven and earth and all creatures and governs them. The main thing you need to know about this is that God is not disconnected from what is happening in the world today. There is no such thing as chance or luck or fate or karma. Rather, God is upholding, governing and ordering all things. "Whatever the Lord pleases, he does, in heaven and on earth, in the seas and all deeps" (Psalm 135:6). Believers should cultivate the lifestyle to give thanks for our protection.

EDUCATION/INTERACTION PERIOD

  1. Thanking God: The True Source of Protection

    Failure to understand God's divine protection can make a believer to be an ingrate and not recognising the power of God in protecting His people. The word `protection' may bring up images of law enforcement agents, safety appliances, or office security systems. You may likely remember someone or something that has been put in place to keep you out of harm's way. However, these protective measures do not always work. Despite having burglar alarms in place, homes and businesses are still broken into almost daily. Vehicle thefts continue to rise and hackers still invade our privacy by spying on us through the internet. But the true source of protection is God Almighty. God our refuge must be thanked for His protection over our lives. "For you have been my refuge, a strong tower against the foe" (Psalms 61:3). He alone must receive credit and thanksgiving for the protection we are enjoying every day. We can give thanks to Him by praising His holy name. He is our Shield, Fortress, Hiding Place, Keeper, Refuge, Rock, Shade, Shelter, and Stronghold (Psalms 46:1, 91). "The God of my rock; in him will I trust: he is my shield, and the horn of my salvation, my high tower, and my refuge, my saviour; thou saved me from violence. I will call on the Lord, who is worthy to be praised: so shall I be saved from mine enemies" (2 Samuel 22:3-4).

    Sharing Time: What or who protects us CCTV system/security gadgets or God the Almighty?

  2. Thanking God Because His Protection is Extremely Powerful

    When we pray to the Lord, one thing that we all ask God is for Him to protect us. Because He loves us and because He is all-powerful, we count on Him to keep us safe from harm. We trust Him to look after us. We need His protection because we are so weak and so vulnerable, but He is powerful. There are so many things that can hurt us, that without Him we could not survive. But His power is keeping us. He did not withdraw His presence. He remains our refuge till today (Psalms 23:4). This God deserves to receive our thanksgiving. In fact, without the Lord protecting us from those things which threaten our spirits, we would not survive for a single moment. Believers should always appreciate the Lord\'s protection. Our God deserves to receive our thanksgiving, He is a Mighty Fortress. We need to thank Him for His unfailing protection.

    Sharing Time: In whom should we put our trust, the security personnel whom we can call but fails to respond or God who is always attentive to our call?

  3. Thanking God for His Protection in all Circumstances

    Mankind wants to see God's protection as a magic force that keeps from all harm. Yes, God can stop any evil or destruction but we must remember that we live in a fallen world where we have freewill and sometimes God works in ways that we do not understand. Sometimes God's protection comes in the form of peace and strength in the middle of despair; at other times it comes as an ending because He sees something more on the horizon that we cannot see. As a believer in Jesus, we are promised a new life covered under the protection of God in which nothing can separate us. Rest assured knowing that no matter what hardship you face, God is your provider and protector. As Christ's disciples, we should give thanks for His protection in all situations.

    Sharing Time: Why should we thank God even in the unbearable situations?

Facilitator's Closing Remarks

The Almighty God deserves our thanks offering at all times because He is good and His love for us endures forever. We can be sure of God\'s continuous protection if we cultivate the attitude of thanksgiving for His protection. "He who sacrifices thank offerings honors me, and prepares the way so that I may show him the salvation of God" (Psalms 50:23). Though God is our protector, but we must do our part by not tempting Him. God does protect us according to His will (Psalms 91:1-16), this means "in our best interest" (even though we may not be able to see it at the time). He wants us to make it into His Kingdom and be part of His eternal family.

Activity Period

  1. In what ways would you give thanks to God for His protection upon your life, family, career/business and ministry?

ROADMAP FOR DISCIPLES

Thanksgiving is a definite attitude. It is a choice we make. We can either be thankful and express gratitude for the rich blessings of God, or else, we can grumble, murmur and complain about our circumstances. The choice is ours. William Law said, "The greatest saint in the world is not he who prays the most or fasts the most; it is not he who gives most alms, or is most eminent for temperance, chastity or justice. It is he who is most thankful to God, and who has a heart always ready to praise Him." Are you living a thanksgiving lifestyle? Are you on daily basis appreciating God for the gift of life, salvation, provision, and protection? Are you grateful to God because of His blessings or you always thank Him no matter the circumstances?

title: submission of mary to god's will
message:
DECEMBER WEEK 1

SUBMISSION OF MARY TO GOD'S WILL

HYMN: BH 73 Gentle Mary Laid Her Child

SCRIPTURE: Luke 1:26-38, 42

Objectives :

By the end of the lesson, members should be able to:

  1. Highlight some qualities in Mary which every disciple of Christ\'s must emulate;
  2. Give a reason why Mary submitted to God\'s will;
  3. Explain what should be their attitude to God\'s assignment, even if it is a difficult one.

ICE BREAKING PERIOD: Discussion

"You will never achieve God\'s best for your life, God\'s greatness for your life, or God\'s purpose for your life until you come to a point where you want to do His will more than anything else" (Brandon Park, 2012). Discuss this assertion in five minutes.

Facilitator's Opening Remarks

Mary was a virgin engaged to Joseph. Then God told her, through an angel, that she was going to have a child by the Holy Spirit. Being aware of the repercussion because of the tradition that forbade an unmarried lady from getting pregnant, Mary still submitted to God. We also must submit to God at all times.

EDUCATION/INTERACTION PERIOD

  1. Before God could use someone such a person must be of right standing with Him. But should be noted that, God\'s choice and favour over a person can qualify him/her for His assignment. Mary was qualified to conceive the Messiah because she was a highly favoured virgin. There had been a prophecy in the Old Testament that the Saviour would come through a virgin. So, she fits into that prophecy. Nevertheless, Mary was not the only virgin in Israel, but God favoured and chose her. Since God is omniscient, probably He must have seen in Mary certain virtues which made Him favour her. Therefore, we must establish that beyond being a virgin and being engaged to a man from the linage of David, Mary was highly favoured by God. As a disciple, you must exhibit godly virtues that can attract God\'s favour. One of such characters is holiness. Let holiness be your hallmark and do not compromise your faith in Christ.

    Sharing Time: Mention and discuss some godly virtues that can attract God\'s favour to you.

  2. Mary's Submission to God's will

    The word "Submission" according to the Encarta dictionary is "the act of yielding or surrendering to somebody" especially to a higher authority. Submission, as a virtue, may be difficult to exhibit especially when one is full of ego. But for Mary, she did not allow ego, fear, people's speculations and the consequences of being pregnant outside wedlock to deter her from submitting to God. The fact is, as a human, she was surprised at the angel\'s message, and that necessitated her question: "How will this be, since I am a virgin?" Nevertheless, after the angel answered her question. Her response:she received the message and responded thus: I am the Lord\'s servant. May it be to me as you have said (Luke 1:38, NIV). This shows that she agreed wholeheartedly with God. What could have helped Mary to submit promptly to God? Faith! She believed in God that He could use her.

    As Christ\'s disciples, we must know and accept that Christ saved us for His good purposes. As such, our lifestyle must give glory to God. Also, we should demonstrate our love and faith in Christ by being submissive to Him at all times, even if we have to experience some discomfort.

    Sharing Time: How easy do we submit to God in the church today? Share a practical experience of how submission to God in difficult situation can be.

  3. Blessings of Submission to God's Will

    There are consequences for every action, which could be positive or negative. For Mary, her act of submission to God earned her the following blessings:

    1. She was a blessed mother (v. 42a).

    2. She gave birth to the blessed child (v. 42b).

    3. She brought goodness to Elizabeth (v.43).

    4. She had joy for believing God (v.45).

    5. She is remembered by all generations (v. 48), especially Christ\'s disciples.

    6. She was blessed with other children.

    Sharing Time: What does the word "submission" mean to you? Mention some rewards of submitting to God.

Facilitator's Closing Remarks

In a world where people preferred to have their ways rather than submitting to God's will, it is needful for Christ's disciples to remain steadfast in submitting to God. We should not prioritise our desires, ambitions, careers, status, children, and so on more than God's will for our lives. Even if submitting to God will cause us our status, privileges and the likes, we must not be deterred to remain at the centre of God's purpose for us.

Activity Period

  1. How often do you submit to God's will?
  2. What should be your reaction to God's assignment, even if it is a difficult one?
  3. Encourage someone who finds it difficult to submit to God's will this week.

title: god's ultimate power and generosity
message:
DECEMBER WEEK 2

GOD'S ULTIMATE POWER AND GENEROSITY

HYMN: BH 77 Away in a Manger

SCRIPTURE: Luke 1:34-37; Matthew 1:18-23

Objectives :

By the end of the lesson, members should be able to:

  1. Explain their understanding of God's ultimate power and generosity.
  2. Highlight some unique events in the story of Christ's birth which revealed God's power;
  3. Express confidence in God's power in every situation.
  4. Demonstrate generosity to the needy around them.

ICE BREAKING PERIOD: Testimony

Mr Olusegun Olabisi, who works in Abeokuta was once the Youth Secretary of Abeokuta East Baptist Association. One day, he travelled to Lagos for an important business with the mind to quickly return to Abeokuta for a naming ceremony. He boarded a taxi at Ojuelegba which was going his direction. The taxi picked another lady to make the passenger complete. Suddenly, two men who were seated with them at the back, just covered their faces with handkerchiefs and that was all they remembered, only to wake up and found themselves naked in a very big compound with a huge fence. They were in front of an herbalist who asked for their names. The lady\'s name was Grace, but bearing Grace could not save anyone who is not under grace. The herbalist said she would be useful for money ritual, while Segun was not. But the evil men were angry that Segun was not useful for ritual. So they gave him pap to eat and asked him to be cutting grass at the back of the house while preparing to use Grace. As he was cutting grass, God showed His ultimate power by filling Segun with the Holy Spirit and asked him to go and face the ritualists.
