He obeyed the Holy Spirit and confronted them by speaking in tongues. When they saw him and heard him saying some things, they were all confused and ran away. Segun then loosed Grace, they and picked their both clothes and ran away. After running in the bush for some days, they found themselves at the Nigeria/Benin Republic boundary. What can you say about the deliverance of Mr. Olusegun Olabisi and Grace?

Facilitator's Opening Remarks

God's ultimate power was displayed in the life of t Mary, who though a virgin was found with a child of the Holy Spirit. Each member should understand that our God is the Omnipotent (all powerful); Omnipresent (available everywhere) and Omniscient (all knowing). Whatever He has decided in His heart, nobody can stop it. Let us pay attention as we discuss God\'s ultimate power and generosity in Christmas story.

EDUCATION/INTERACTION PERIOD

  1. God Displays His Ultimate Power through the Conception of Jesus

    The birth of Jesus and His infancy fulfilled the Old Testament prophecies foretold centuries before Christ (Isaiah 7:14; 9:6-7; Micah 5:2; Hosea 11:1b; Jeremiah 31:15). God initiated the whole process of the birth of Jesus. The power of the almighty God miraculously brought about the virginal conception by the direct action of the Holy Spirit. The virgin birth of Christ established two basic facts. Firstly, it asserted a real human nature in Christ taken from His mother. Secondly, it asserted a real divine nature because of His supernatural birth which was unique in the history of humankind, setting Jesus apart as one Who has both true and genuine humanity and undiminished deity united in one Person forever.

  2. God's Ultimate Power in Christmas Story

    God's ultimate power has to do with His supremacy, sovereignty and authority in control of the affairs of humankind. There is nothing our God cannot do and no one can question Him for what He does or does not do. From the story of the birth of Jesus Christ in Matthew 1:18-23, God displayed His power by making a virgin to be pregnant. He also communicated His intention to Joseph, her betrothed husband. God\'s power over nature is revealed in using a star to announce the birth to the Magi and using the star to guide them to the baby to worship Him and offer Him gifts. This shows that God can use anything, animate or inanimate, to bring about His purpose for humanity. The gifts that the Magi offered to Jesus were symbolic of His redemptive mission on earth. Furthermore, God\'s power was revealed in the fact that He was in control of every event which surrounded the birth of Jesus Christ. The decree that everyone should go for census in their home town, God\'s instructions to the Magi not to return to King Herod and to Joseph to take the baby and His mother to Egypt for asylum, were proofs of God\'s power in action. God\'s power is still available today. We can experience it if we walk closely with Him daily and genuinely trust Him. Whatever may be your life\'s challenge marital, academic, economic/financial, health, social, child bearing trust God absolutely. Our God does great things and He will show His power in your situation. God\'s power is still available today to deliver and to save. You too will experience this power in your life and family in Jesus\' name.

    Sharing Time: Describe the power of God in the incarnation of Jesus. Share a testimony of God's greatness in your life or family that really displayed God's ultimate power?

  3. God's Generosity in Christmas Story

    God's generosity relates to His act of kindness and love in giving us His only Son as the Saviour of the whole world. He says, "She will give birth to a son, and you are to give him the name Jesus, because he will save his people from their sins" (Matthew 1:21). God does not want us to perish, hence the reason for allowing Jesus Christ to come into the world (John 3:16). God's generosity is evidenced in this sacrificial giving of His Son to come and save humanity from sin. If God could be so generous not to spare His only Son, will He not be ready to give us all other good things our hearts desire according to His will? Or will He not expect us to emulate His character by extending helping hands to the needy around us? As Christ's disciples today, we must trust God and depend solely on Him to supply our needs at this Christmas season. We should refrain from seeking for help where there is no help and avoid going into debt because of cloth. We must also emulate God's generous attitude by being ready to give to those who need our help. Our lives should be channels of blessings to others around us. Christmas season is a time to reflect on God\'s generosity to us and to let the act of generosity spread to others through us, to fellow believers and unbelievers alike. We should give our love, our substance, our time, our kind words of advice etc to others.

    Sharing Time: These days, can God still display His power in unusual ways in our midst?

Facilitator's Closing Remarks

Do you doubt God because of what you are passing through? Don't worry, if He could bring forth a child through a virgin, then you can be sure that He will demonstrate His power in your own life too. You are next to share a testimony.

Activity Period

  1. Ponder on this statement, "God's power and generosity is still present in our time to do the unimaginable."
  2. Tell of God's power and generosity to someone around you whose hope needs to be revived this week.

title: obedience of joseph and the magi
message:
DECEMBER WEEK 3

OBEDIENCE OF JOSEPH AND THE MAGI

HYMN: BH 260 When We Walk with the Lord

SCRIPTURE: Matthew 1:20-25; 2:9-15, 19-23

Objectives :

By the end of the lesson, members should be able to:

  1. Highlight different instances of Joseph's obedience to God's instruction;
  2. Mention at least four qualities that helped Joseph to obey;
  3. Mention and explain qualities that helped the Magi to obey;
  4. Tell someone the importance of obedience to believers in Christ.

ICE BREAKING PERIOD: Case Study (Matthew 21:28-31a)

A man had two sons, and he came to the first son and said: "Son, go, work today in my vine- yard." The son replied, "I will not". After sometimes he had a rethink and decided to go. He said, "After all, he is my father, I must obey him; let me go, and he went. The father came to the second son and said likewise: "Son, go, work today in my vineyard." He replied, "Yes sir, I will go right away" But after his father left, he mocked his father and took another way. He also laughed, "Ah, ah, ah! He never knew that I deceived him; foolish father, let me go and play with my friends. Which of the two sons obeyed the words of their father?

Facilitator's Opening Remarks

Obedience is compliance with an order, request, or law. It is an act of submission to authority. It is also the quality of being obedient. It is a behaviour that is respectful of rules and laws. Obedience to God is a sign that you love Him. It is important to God and He expects all His children to obey Him. After discovering Mary was pregnant, it was difficult for Joseph to take her as a wife and went on with the marriage plans; but when he knew it was God\'s will, he obeyed. Likewise the Magi, though they lived thousands of miles away from where Jesus was born, yet they took it upon themselves to visit the newborn king. Their obedience to God\'s instruction not to go back to Herod was a loyalty to God that all of us should emulate. We have invited two pastors to help us in this discussion. Our first guest is Pastor Olaide Alao, who just graduated from the Baptist College of Theology, Benin city, and Pastor Mrs Oluwakemi Odediran, who graduated from the Nigerian Baptist Theological Seminary, Ogbomoso.

EDUCATION/INTERACTION PERIOD

Facilitator: You are welcome to this programme sir and ma.

We will start with Pastor Olaide Alao: Sir, why is it difficult for some Christians to obey God\'s Word today?

Pastor Olaide Alao: Human beings are increasingly becoming self-centred. They want others to obey and serve them but they are not ready to obey someone in authority over them. People find it difficult to obey God because of the sinful nature which is still active. Submission comes before obedience, and not many are willing to submit to God, hence obedience is difficult.

Sharing Time: In your own opinion, why is it not easy for Christians to obey God?

Facilitator: Thank you sir. Can you also shed light on the evidence of obedience in Joseph\'s life?

Pastor Olaide Alao: The obedience of Joseph can be seen in the following instances:

1. He followed God\'s instruction through Angel Gabriel to take Mary as his wife because her pregnancy was of the Holy Spirit and that she would give birth to the Saviour of the world. He also named the baby "Jesus" as the angel told him. He believed and trusted the angel\'s message and accepted Mary (Matthew 1:20-25).

2. He and his wife obeyed Caesar Augustus decree that everyone should travel to his home of origin for census, despite Mary\'s advanced state of pregnancy. His obedience made the prophecy that Jesus will be born at Bethlehem to be fulfilled (Luke 2:1-7).

3. He followed God's instruction to move Mary and Baby Jesus to Egypt for protection against King Herod\'s evil plan to kill "Jesus". He did not leave Egypt until when God told him to return when Herod died (Matthew 2:13-15, 19-21).

Facilitator: Thank you sir for that beautiful exposition. We now listen to our mummy. Ma, what are those things that helped Joseph to obey God's Word?

Pastor Mrs Oluwakemi Odediran: Thank you our facilitator. Looking into the passage read, we would observe some qualities in Joseph\'s life. These include:

1. Just and tender heart: the Bible says, "then Joseph her husband, being a just man" (Matthew 1:19). In the Jewish beliefs and practices, if a betrothed lady becomes pregnant for another man, she should be stoned to death. Joseph was faced with only two options; either to divorce Mary quietly or to expose her and have her stoned to death. He eventually chose to divorce her secretly. At the angel\'s intervention and explanation, his just and tender heart towards Mary helped him to obey. It simply means Joseph was a clean, pure and holy man before God. If a man is just before God, obedience will not be difficult.

2. Spiritual sensitivity: Joseph was a descendant of King David and was sensitive to God\'s guidance. There were prophesies that the Messiah will come from the lineage of David and it appears that Joseph may not be able to stop God\'s plan even if he would not obey the commandment. What should also be noticed about Joseph was his sensitivity to God\'s guidance. He knew the way God spoke to him and he was ready to obey.

3. Fear of God and desire to please Him: Joseph, being a righteous man, according to the Scriptures, is a clear evidence of the fear of God in him and this automatically stirred up his desire to please God.

4. Genuine love for God and Mary: In the first instance, Joseph's decision not to subject Mary to public ridicule shows that he loved her genuinely. This also helped him to obey the Word of God through the angel. Jesus tells His disciples, "If you love me, you will obey what I command" (John 14:15, NIV).

5. Absolute faith and trust in God's Word: Joseph's absolute faith and trust in God helped him to obey the angel's messages to him. According to Rick Warren "... we must show our faith by doing what God tells us to do". Therefore, Joseph's obedience revealed his faith in God.

Sharing Time: Mention those qualities that helped Joseph to obey God's will?

Facilitator: Thank you ma. Sir, what are those things that helped the Magi (wise men) to obey God\'s Word?

Pastor Olaide Alao:

1. They were truth seekers: The Magi were truth seekers. To obey God's instructions may be difficult but when you are actually seeking the truth, you will be ready to do anything. Unfortunately today, not many people come to church to seek the truth about Jesus. Some come to church to fulfil all righteousness or to follow traditions. You cannot obey God when you are not a truth seeker.

2. The wise men have the right motive for seeking Jesus: They said in Matthew 2:2, "Where is He, who has been born king of the Jews? For we have seen His star in the east and have come to worship Him.'' The main reason why they were seeking Jesus was to worship Him. Since they have accepted Him as King, it was then easy for them to obey the instruction given to them by God: "being divinely warned in a dream that they should not return to Herod, they departed for their own country another way" Matthew 2:12.

Sharing Time: Mention those qualities that helped the Magi to obey God's Word?

Facilitator: Thank you sir. You have to understand that God deserves our worship and submission. These can be actualised when we learn to obey Him in all things. Though others may have disapproved of Joseph's decision to continue with Mary, he chose to obey God. Like Joseph, we must choose to obey God rather than seek the approval of man.

Activity Period

  1. How have you been handling God's instructions to you?
  2. Tell someone this week about the importance of obedience to God's Word and qualities that can help him or her to obey.

title: god's protection and intervention (herod's evil plan)
message:
DECEMBER WEEK 4

GOD'S PROTECTION AND INTERVENTION (HEROD'S EVIL PLAN)

HYMN: BH 40 A Mighty Fortress Is Our God

SCRIPTURE: Matthew 2:13-20

Objectives :

By the end of the lesson, members should be able to:

  1. Express their faith in the saving power of God;
  2. Explain the different ways by which God demonstrate's and reveals His power of protection over Jesus; and
  3. Pray for grace to trust God for His intervention in all their challenges.

ICE BREAKING PERIOD: Sharing

Two to three members should share their personal experiences of God's protection and intervention from/in dangerous situations and their convictions about God's saving power.

Facilitator's Opening Remarks

Many times, we face situations and circumstances that are too difficult for us. Some, at such time seek help from friends, relatives, enemies and even Satan. When Jesus was born, Herod sought to kill Him but God made a way of escape. Even though the parents did not know about the evil plans of Herod, God already made a way of escape before Herod could strike. I pray for you as you listen today, that God will make way of escape and protection for you in all you are facing in Jesus\' name. Today, we are learning from the story of Herod and God\'s protection and intervention in saving people.

EDUCATION/INTERACTION PERIOD

  1. Herod's Response to the News of Jesus' Birth and His Evil Plan Concerning Jesus

    The news of Jesus' birth was relayed to King Herod by the Magi who saw His Star in the east and then travelled to Israel to visit and worship the baby king. When King Herod heard the news, he was greatly disturbed and angry. His anger emanated from his pride and ego as a king. He saw Jesus as the one who had come to take up his position and so he was envious of Him. He told the Magi to go and search for Jesus so that he too could come and worship Him, though he had the intention to kill Jesus. This confirms is the Word of God that says "the heart is deceitful above all things and beyond cure, who can understand it? (Jeremiah 17:9). These are two opposite responses to Jesus' birth. The Magi saw the star and they traced it to go and worship the new born king; Herod heard the news and became angry and a murderer. How do you normally respond to another person's success? Do you feel happy and then rejoice with them or you despise the person's success because of your pride or ego? As Christ's disciples, God expects us to be happy with other people's success and then rejoice with them. We must avoid envying and despising others for their success. Envy can lead to hatred and subsequently lead to murder.

    Sharing Time: Can you explain why Herod was troubled when he heard the news of the new king?

  2. God's Protection and Intervention: Matthew 2:12-21

    To every evil plan concerning God's children, there is always God's intervention. God is omniscienct, He knows all things. He Himself says in Jeremiah 17:10, "I the LORD search the heart and examine the mind, to reward a man according to his conduct, according to what his deeds deserve." Psalm 46:1 also says "God is our refuge and strength, an ever-present help in trouble." God knew Herod's mind towards Jesus, the Magi did not know God, who knew the indepth thought of a human's heart, intervened by:

    · Revealing Herod's evil plan to the Magi in a dream, so that they would not disclose Jesus' location to Herod as a way of protection for Jesus.

    · Sending His angel to tell Joseph to take the child and His mother and escape to Egypt because of Herod's evil plan to search for and kill Jesus.

    In like manner, God can protect and intervene in the situation of His people by using divine endowment like dream to communicate to people. God can equally use any other spiritual gifts to expose the evil plans of the enemy. All you need do is to be attentive and identify the way God communicates to you. Also, God can protect His people and intervene in their situations by sending His angels. I pray for you that God will send His ministering angels to come to your aid and protect you from all evils in Jesus' name.

    Sharing Time: Explain different ways by which God demonstrates and revealed His power of protection over Jesus.

  3. Obedience of the Wise Men and Joseph: Matthew 2:12, 14, 21

    God can protect us from all evil and intervene in our case to confuse the enemy, but if you will not do what God instructs you to do, you may lose His protection and intervention . The wise men did not go back to Herod and Joseph did everything he was instructed to do. You too must develop an obedient heart if you want to continue to receive the protection and intervention of God in your life.

Facilitator's Closing Remarks

God delivered the new born King Jesus from the fiery sword of Herod (Matthew 2:16-18) using angels, spiritual gifts, and the obedience of wise men and Joseph. Are you also passing through a problem, persecution or pain? If only you can give your whole life to Jesus and trust Him completely; then, He will protect you and show up in whatever you are passing through. The choice is yours now. Let us read out together the lyrics of the following hymn:

Jesus is tenderly calling thee home, Calling today, calling today;

Why from the sunshine of love wilt thou roam; Farther and farther away?

Calling today, calling today; Jesus is calling; Is tenderly calling today.


(BH 229)

Activity Period

  1. Verbalise your faith in God and pray for grace to trust Him for His intervention in all your challenges.

title: jesus christ, the source of life
message:
DECEMBER WEEK 5

JESUS CHRIST, THE SOURCE OF LIFE

HYMN: BH 155 Jesus Is All the World to Me

SCRIPTURE: John 1:1-5

Objectives :

By the end of the lesson, members should be able to:

  1. Explain what they understand as the meaning of life.
  2. Give biblical exposition of the source of life;
  3. Assure someone that Jesus alone is the source of life;

ICE BREAKING PERIOD: Discussion

We have noticed that nowadays, almost everybody knows what medicine should be used for different ailments. People now prescribe medicine, herbs and various ways of healing. In what ways do you think this trend is affecting our faith in Christ as the only source of life?

Facilitator's Opening Remarks

So many people on the television and radio are claiming that they can give life to people. Even some so-called "prophets" brag on the media that they can give life. Today, we shall be examining how Jesus is the only source of life.

EDUCATION/INTERACTION PERIOD

  1. Life in its Broad Sense

    There are three forms of life; the physical, the spiritual and the eternal life. Life has no limitation, and it is to be understood in its widest sense. Quoting Webster, Cheryl Anderson defines life as "the sequence of physical and mental experiences that make up the existence of an individual". He further adds that life is a continuum of accomplishment, failure, discovery, dilemma, challenge, boredom, sadness, disappointments, appreciation, the giving and receipt of grace, empathy, peace, and our reactions to all sorts of stimuli touch, love, friendship, loss... Life is the ability to grow, change or exist physically, spiritually or eternally.

    1. Physical life: Life begins at conception. Scientists say human development begins after the union of male and female gametes or germ cells during a process known as fertilization and conception takes place when the fertilized egg (zygote) implanted itself in the uterus. The zygote then develops into foetus and continues to develop until the delivery period. After the delivery, the growth even becomes faster and life continues. The ability to move, act, live, work, think, play and labour is called life.

    2. Spiritual life: This is a state of life that begins with an encounter with our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ. It is when one is convicted of his/her sinful nature by the Holy Spirit, confessed those sins, asked God for forgiveness and cleansing of his/her sins and surrender his/her life to Jesus Christ as his/her personal Saviour and Lord. At this point, there is spiritual conversion from the kingdom of Satan to that of God through salvation, and so a new life (spiritual life) begins in the person; which is basically brought about by an inner transformation. When this happens, the spiritual life develops through prayer, Bible study, fasting, fellowship with other Christians and witnessing to non-Christians.

    3. Eternal life: This is a spiritual existence after the death of the body; though, eternal life is not something that begins when we get to heaven but something we possess in this life by knowing God. John 17 verse 3 says. "Now this is eternal life: that they know you, the only true God, and Jesus Christ, whom you have sent." This suggests that eternal life is the ultimate goal of salvation in Christ here on earth and a successful journey of that salvation guarantees a life after here with Christ.

    Sharing Time: Explain the emergence of life and the activity of God in making life meaningful.

  2. Jesus Christ, the Source of Life
    1. Biblical basis: The Bible says in John 1:4, "In Him was life". This suggests that quality and truthful life is found in Jesus Christ. Only in Him we can find meaning for our existence. An author said that Jesus Christ is the Creator of life and His life brings light to human aid. Before the world was created Jesus Christ had life and this life is what enlightens the physical and spiritual lives. The same life will see us through the world to the life eternal. It is written in the book of Acts that, "In Him we live and move and have our being…" (Acts 17:28). Everything we are and will be finds its source in Christ.
    2. He came that we might have life: John 10:10 When Jesus was born, the Bible says." …And you shall call His name Jesus, for He will save His people from their sins" (Matthew 1:21). He actually came to the world at Christmas to give life to the world by giving us free salvation. No one would have been able to do this for us except Jesus, who came purposely that we might have life. He is the Bread of life (John 6:41); He is the water of life (John 4:13-14); He is life Himself (John 11:25; 14:6).

    Sharing Time: Can you give reasons and evidence of Jesus being the source of life?

  3. Jesus is the life-giving Spirit: I Corinthians 15:45

    The first Adam was made man, lived as man and died as man. But Jesus, though was considered as the last Adam, He came to give life to us. Everyone needs this life of Christ in order to gain eternity in heaven. As we move to another year, the question to ask is; have you found this new life? If yes, congratulations. I encourage you to continue to live that new life for Jesus Christ the giver of life. If not, then you need to accept Jesus Christ Who gives life to all in abundance, as your personal Saviour and Lord and that life will be yours.

Facilitator's Closing Remarks

Jesus loves us so much that He gave His life for us that we might have life eternal. Jesus Christ though God Himself did not consider it robbery to be equal with God (Philippians 2:6). There is no life elsewhere but in Christ Jesus alone. Surrender your life to Him and He will give you a new life in full measure.

Activity Period

  1. Have you found the new life in Jesus Christ? How are you living the life?

ROADMAP FOR DISCIPLES

We have studied messages from Christmas stories. How do we celebrate Christmas? Do we give foods and gifts to only those in church or we extend it to the lost ones? Do you obey God and His instructions for you? Do you rely solely on His power to save and deliver? Ponder on it whether you are an exemplary Christian, a true disciple. Jesus Christ came into the world that the world through Him might be saved. The story of Christmas is known by all men and we are being reminded again that a disciple of Christ will go back to the Bible and appropriate its message to day to day life. The focus of Jesus' birth is love for the world (John 3:16). Thus, the lifestyle of a disciple should be one that manifests the love of God in Christ to the world through giving and sharing. Be like Christ by showing love to all men Christians and non-Christians. Have you received the challenge to tell the stories of Christmas to the world, emphasising the messages of love, salvation, freedom and sharing? As Christ's disciple, are you committed to living your life now and in eternity for Jesus Who is the only source of life?
